trends: There have been 16 other sightings in Newark
There were no other sightings in Newark on or around October 12th 2013
divs: sighting detailson 10-12-13, 8:00pm, while looking at the night sky from my back yard, i observed initially a red light coming out of the east. it appeared to be at a normal aircraft altitude, but i could see that the light was solid red and not strobing like a normal navigation light would. i grabbed my 10x50 binoculars from the house and observed that the object was comprised of 3 lights altogether, with the red light being on the starboard side. the other two lights were white (lead light and port side). the 3 lights were in a triangle pattern and remained as solid lights for the entire duration i observed it (approx. 7 minutes)as it headed away from me going due west. as the craft was nearly directly above me, the red starboard light suddenly went from the bright red, to a matching white of the other two lights on the craft. as the craft was cruising at the speed of a normal aircraft, my guess would be about 500mph and at a altitude of about 40,000 ft. my guess would be that the craft size was that of about a normal airliner. if i had held a ruler at arms length, i would say that the lights on the craft would of been evenly spaced, about a quarter of a inch apart from each other. i could easily see the craft with the naked eye. i tried to look for details on the craft with my binoculars that would tell me if this was a normal aircraft, but i did not see any of the normal tell\tale signs. there were no strobing navigation lights and no tail section lights at all. i consider aviation as a hobby of mine and enjoy aviation history. i am familiar with most aircraft and can easily identify known aircraft & detect objects in the night sky like satellites, the space station, landing lights of approaching aircraft, etc,... i believe that most individuals would not of noticed this particular sighting as unusual and dismissed it as a normal aircraft flying overhead. i knew better. thank you!
Summary: Observed 3 (non - strobing) lights in a triangle shape. Did not resemble normal aircraft.
